data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
BCCH Clinical Practice Guideline on Use of HFNC in Bronchiolitis

Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of bronchiolitis: first episode wheeze before 12 months age, with a preceding viral prodrome progressing to tachypnea, wheeze, crackles and variable respiratory distress
- Evidence of RSV+ not required
In children ages 1-2 years, consider assessment for asthma

Exclusion Criteria:
- Comorbidities at risk of respiratoryfailure (less than 32week GA, VLBW, CLD, hemodynamically significant CHD, genetic disorder, neuromuscular disease, anatomic airway/lung abnormalities, craniofacial abnormalities, immunodeficiency). Note: may have more severe course
- Acute complications of disease process (significant apneas, pneumothorax)
- High risk for intubation (history of intubation or PICU admission)
- Uncertain diagnosis (query bacterial pneumonia or asthma)
q4h, when continuous pulse oximetry greater than 90% for greater than 2 hours on room air, minimal work of breathing, and no concerns from bedside nurse
Mild - Moderate Work of Breathing consider:
Consider NG / OG feeds if Respiration greater than 60. NG/OG for maintenance fluids are as effective as IV hydration in bronchiolitis
Consider NPO if risk factors for severe course [see protocol exclusion criteria or concern for NIPPV / intubation
PED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)
400 unit, PO, qdaily, drug form: oral liq
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once
If patient on continuous IV infusions then consider daily electrolytes
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
